course.title: Machine Learning A-Z™: Hands-On Python & R In Data Science
course.subtitle: Learn to create Machine Learning Algorithms in Python and R from two Data Science experts. Code templates included.

reviews.body: This course delivers what it promises (hands-on approach) and more (in the form of bonuses and additional references). Recommended for people who know the theory but seriously lack the implementation practice.

Absolutely Fantastic course. I appreciate the patience that Kirill and Hadelin ha shown in explaining such difficult concepts step by step. Kudos to them !!. Absolutely must for beginners.

2 areas which I felt should have been included

1. The mathematical concepts behind each of the models. While Kirill and Hadelin have touched upon those but detailed explanation would have enhanced the value further.

2. Some real life case studies for each of the models.

Both of the above would have made the course a little more longer but could have transformed this course into a PG diploma equivalent.

First and Foremost, Thanks alot to UDEMY and excellent faculty members. You folks are amazingly admirable. Either Class room teaching or computer based online trainings at affordable price is truly gift of god to aspirants who believe in education and knowledge sharing. Keep up spreading the education across the globe as much more as you can! with great Respect and Love, Subhash Raghu Pabbineedi :-)

Hadelin's speech style (frequent hard pauses after every few words) makes it very difficult to focus on and absorb the content. His excessive and needless repetition of words/terms/concepts makes the narration unnecessarily bulky and quite distracting. The delivery needs to be more crisp, concise, and easy flowing.

More importantly, in many cases, this narrator simply brushes aside the difference between a prediction and an actual value, and calls any model output as good without much, if any, substantiation!

On the good side, the course provides just enough sample code to get going and practicing the algorithm on larger, real-life datasets. Both presenters are energetic and seem adequately knowledgeable to deliver the content. I hope that Hadelin adjusts his speech style to make the course more engaging and enjoyable.

This course is superb. Having completed the earlier R Programming courses from Kirill Eremenko, I obtained a fairly basic handle on the core R language (having no experience beforehand), and felt ML would be a good next challenge. I committed to complete the entire course - which is quite comprehensive - and I'm quite glad I did as I now feel as if I have enough of a handle on building up these models and can at least speak intelligently about them. The coding skills of Hadelin de Ponteves are quite impressive and there were many little tricks and takeaways that can be applied elsewhere in your work. I do have one important complaint and that is regarding working with the H2o platform in the ANN lecture. There are many, many complaints on this topic which have not been addressed by the author(s). I came to the solution after much research and it involves installing a compatible version of Java JDK on your machine. The documentation is found on the H2o website. As of today, H2o does not support the most recent version of Java (15) so you will need to download an earlier version from the Java archive. Installing/uninstalling is a bit of a pain, but good luck.

It was a good introduction, though I wished that there were more things that it could have been more clear about. I wished it covered more interesting stuff, but I suppose that would be for their Deep Learning Course.
This was amazing journey. I spend over 40 hours learn how implement AI algorithm in Python and R. Great job. Thank you Mr. Hadelin and Mr. Kirill so much. Enjoy machine learning!

Loved the Intuitions part, really helped to dive into the course and understand well.

A good coding example also to learn to implement both in R and Python. Great tips and tricks all along the course.

I would say this is a long journey for me to finish this course even during the COVID period! But!!! I literally enjoy the course content and the way of teaching by the instructor! Thanks, @Kirill Eremenko! I like your teaching tempo as well as a clear explanation! You will definitely learn many toolkits for machine learning as a data scientist especially for the beginner who has the intention to proceed with a data scientist career in the future like me!

What a great course for starting my machine learning journey. I am a mechanical engineer and have found a love for software engineering/ data science. this course was perfect for me because i have a background in math and computer science already and was able to absorb and learn a lot from this course quickly. Also, the structure and organization of this course with the coding templates is GOLD!

Thank you for your hard work on making this course.
After going through courses on other platforms I realized that this course builds your foundation in Machine learning and not just tells you how to use the libs.

I really enjoy how there was more emphasis on the theory part than the programming part. But I think a more in-depth knowledge of maths behind all the theory would help us understand and learn more. Overall, great course, would definitely recommend it.

instructor.name: Kirill Eremenko
instructor.briefIntroduction:
My name is Kirill Eremenko and I am super-psyched that you are reading this!

Professionally, I am a Data Science management consultant with over five years of experience in finance, retail, transport and other industries. I was trained by the best analytics mentors at Deloitte Australia and today I leverage Big Data to drive business strategy, revamp customer experience and revolutionize existing operational processes.

From my courses you will straight away notice how I combine my real-life experience and academic background in Physics and Mathematics to deliver professional step-by-step coaching in the space of Data Science. I am also passionate about public speaking, and regularly present on Big Data at leading Australian universities and industry events.

To sum up, I am absolutely and utterly passionate about Data Science and I am looking forward to sharing my passion and knowledge with you!
